intro: Virea autumnalis var. minor, commonly known as the lesser autumn virea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The leaves are typically narrow and lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It blooms in the late summer to early autumn, adding delicate beauty to its natural environment.
